meanings.definition: A type of dough made from cornmeal or flour
meanings.sent1: Maria kneaded the masa to make delicious tortillas.
meanings.sent2: The masa for the tamales needed to be mixed well.
meanings.sent3: The masa giggled as it turned into fluffy bread.
meanings.sent4: The masa held the secrets of grandma's traditional recipes.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the masa filled the kitchen with warmth.

meanings.definition: The physical structure of an object or substance
meanings.sent1: The masa of the clay sculpture was carefully molded by the artist.
meanings.sent2: The masa of the building was sturdy and well-built.
meanings.sent3: The masa of the jello wiggled playfully on the plate.
meanings.sent4: The masa of the mountain stood tall against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The masa of the fabric determined its durability.

meanings.definition: A large quantity or amount of something
meanings.sent1: There was a masa of books piled on the table.
meanings.sent2: The chef needed a masa of ingredients to cook for the party.
meanings.sent3: The masa of toys in the room made it hard to walk.
meanings.sent4: A masa of stars filled the night sky with twinkling lights.
meanings.sent5: The farmer harvested a masa of corn from the field.
